description: 共同科英文（二）課程為一學期兩學分課程，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 1. 增進學生英語溝通表達能力 2. 透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神 3. 透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野 4. 透過課堂討論培養批判精神 5. 提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣

*   **Course Description:**

This course aims to improve students’ English proficiency by providing them with intensive training in four skills. It includes a variety of classroom activities designed to expose them to a wide range of real-life issues, improve their communication skills in English, and enhance their critical and creative thinking. Students will also gain abundant experience in working with their classmates. As a requirement of this course, students will also work on a project, which will enable them to apply their English skills and showcase their creativity.

*   **Course Objectives:**

This course aims to (1) develop students’ four skills in English; (2) improve their knowledge of vocabulary and grammar in English; (3) build their confidence in speaking English; (4) enhance their learning motivation; (5) foster their cultural knowledge and intercultural competence; (6) familiarize them with the concept and application of Quality Talk.

*   **Delivery of instruction:**

1.  Lecture
2.  Group discussion & cooperation
3.  Student presentation

*   **Textbook:**

Daise, D., & Norloff, C. (2015). _Q: Skills for success–Reading and writing (Book 4)._ New York, NY: Cambridge University Press.

*   **Grading Policy & Course Requirements:**

**1.     Grading Policy:**

    (1) Attendance/participation: 15%

    (2) Classroom activities & Quizzes: 10%

    (3) Assignments + Reading Reports: 15%

    (4) Midterm project: 15%

    (5) Final project: 35% (5% for Project Portfolio)

    (6) Lexile Test: 10%

**2.    Course requirements**

Class attendance is a fundamental requirement that will be strictly enforced in this course. Students are required to come to class every week. Except for a hospitalized emergency (medical proof needed) or an authorized absence, absence from each class period will result in a **1.5-point deduction** from attendance/participation scores. Arriving late to class or leaving early will count as an absence.

Various classroom activities and quizzes will be conducted in class. If students miss any of the tests, no make-up tests will be given.

**(3) Assignments + Reading Reports (15%)**

Students are required to submit any of their assignments (including reports and projects) before it is due. Late assignments will be marked down by **30%**. Once they are two or more days late, they will NOT be accepted under any circumstances.

Each student needs to submit several scripts for the final project in the midterm week. Details about this midterm project will be announced in the first class meeting.

    **(5) Final Project (35%):**

At the end of this semester, every student needs to submit an individual project along with a project portfolio. The project (30%) will be graded based on the overall quality, and the project portfolio (5%) will be evaluated based on its content and organization. Details about this final project and the grading criteria will be announced in the first class meeting.

**(6) Lexile Test (10%):**

The Lexile Test is a required English proficiency test for all students enrolled in general English classes, and it will be arranged in a class meeting from May 4th to May 29th, 2020.

Students will be informed of exactly when and where they should go to take this test in the near future, and the syllabus may be slightly adjusted according to the exact test date announced by the Foreign Language Education Division. An extra bonus of up to 2% will be given to students who improve on the Lexile test in this semester.
